title: Ezra Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Ezra with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 10 chapters.

questions.question: Who stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia to make a proclamation to build the house of the LORD in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia to fulfill the word by the mouth of Jeremiah.

questions.question: What did Cyrus king of Persia say he was charged to build at Jerusalem?
options: A house of the LORD God of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: A house of the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: Cyrus declared that he was charged to build a house for the LORD God of Israel in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the prince of Judah to whom the vessels of the house of the LORD were delivered?
questions.explanation: Sheshbazzar was the prince of Judah who received the vessels brought from Babylon.

questions.question: How many vessels of gold and silver did Sheshbazzar bring up from Babylon to Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The total vessels of gold and silver were five thousand and four hundred.

questions.question: When did the children of Israel gather as one man to Jerusalem to build the altar of the God of Israel?
questions.explanation: The people gathered in the seventh month to build the altar and offer burnt offerings.

questions.question: Who stood up with Jeshua the son of Jozadak to build the altar of the God of Israel?
questions.explanation: Jeshua the priest and Zerubbabel the governor with their brethren built the altar.

questions.question: What was kept according to the law of Moses when the altar was built?
questions.explanation: They kept the feast of tabernacles as it is written, offering daily burnt offerings.

questions.question: From what region were cedar trees brought to Jerusalem for the temple construction?
questions.explanation: Masons and carpenters received cedar from Sidon and Tyre to build the temple.

questions.question: Who prophesied to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem to encourage them to build the house of God?
questions.explanation: The prophets Haggai and Zechariah prophesied to motivate the rebuilding.

questions.question: Who was the governor on this side of the river who questioned the Jews about building the house of God?
questions.explanation: Tatnai, governor on this side of the river, asked who commanded them to build.

questions.question: According to the elders, who originally built the house of God that they were rebuilding?
questions.explanation: They answered that a great king of Israel built it and set it up.

questions.question: Who destroyed the first house of God and carried the people away into Babylon?
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar destroyed the first temple and took the people captive.

questions.question: Who laid the foundation of the house of God at Jerusalem according to Ezra?
questions.explanation: Sheshbazzar laid the foundation of the house of God in Jerusalem.

questions.question: In whose reign did Ezra the priest, a ready scribe in the law of Moses, go up from Babylon to Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Ezra went up in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia.

questions.question: What was Ezra's main purpose in going up to Jerusalem?
options: To seek the law of the LORD and teach statutes and judgments
questions.correctAnswer: To seek the law of the LORD and teach statutes and judgments
questions.explanation: Ezra prepared his heart to seek the law and teach it in Israel.

questions.question: What did King Artaxerxes grant Ezra concerning the silver and gold to offer to God?
options: Permission to keep it for himself
To carry it and use it for sacrifices and offerings at the temple
To send it back to Persia
questions.correctAnswer: To carry it and use it for sacrifices and offerings at the temple
questions.explanation: The king allowed Ezra to carry silver and gold to offer sacrifices in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What decree did King Artaxerxes make concerning the priests, Levites, singers, porters, and Nethinims?
options: They must pay tribute and taxes
They shall not be taxed or imposed tribute
They must serve in the army
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not be taxed or imposed tribute
questions.explanation: The king decreed that no toll, tribute, or custom be imposed on them.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised the LORD, because the _______ of the house of the LORD was laid.'
questions.explanation: The people shouted with joy because the foundation of the temple was laid.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to ______ in Israel statutes and judgments.'
questions.explanation: Ezra was dedicated to teaching the law and judgments in Israel.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Also we certify you, that touching any of the priests and Levites, singers, porters, Nethinims, or ministers of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose ______, tribute, or custom, upon them.'
questions.explanation: The decree specifically stated no toll, tribute, or custom be imposed on temple workers.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The LORD God of heaven hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged me to build him an _______ at Jerusalem.'
questions.explanation: Cyrus was charged to build a house for the LORD in Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: The people offered burnt offerings upon the altar morning and evening after it was set upon its bases.
questions.explanation: They offered burnt offerings morning and evening as stated in Ezra 3:3.

questions.question: True or False: The foundation of the temple was laid before the first burnt offerings were offered.
questions.explanation: Burnt offerings were offered before the foundation of the temple was laid (Ezra 3:6).

questions.question: True or False: The prophets Haggai and Zechariah prophesied to discourage the Jews from building the house of God.
questions.explanation: They prophesied to encourage and help the Jews build the house of God.

questions.question: True or False: The elders of the Jews claimed they were servants of the God of heaven and earth.
questions.explanation: They identified themselves as servants of the God of heaven and earth (Ezra 5:11).

questions.question: True or False: King Darius sent letters allowing the Jews to continue building the temple after investigation.
questions.explanation: Darius sent a decree permitting the building to continue after inquiry (Ezra 6:1-12).

questions.question: True or False: Ezra was a ready scribe in the law of Moses given by the LORD God of Israel.
questions.explanation: Ezra was skilled in the law of Moses as given by the LORD (Ezra 7:6).

questions.question: True or False: Ezra began his journey from Babylon to Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month.
questions.explanation: He began on the first day of the first month and arrived on the first day of the fifth month (Ezra 7:9).

questions.question: True or False: The people who returned from the captivity to Jerusalem appointed Levites from twenty years old and upward to set forward the work of the house of the LORD.
questions.explanation: Levites from twenty years old and upward were appointed to the temple work (Ezra 3:8).

questions.question: Who was the chief priest standing with Jeshua when the temple foundation was laid?
questions.explanation: Jeshua was the son of Jozadak the chief priest at that time.

questions.question: Who was the son of Shealtiel appointed as a governor and leader in rebuilding the temple?
questions.explanation: Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel was a governor leading the rebuilding efforts.

questions.question: Which king of Persia made the initial decree allowing the Jews to return and build the house of God?
questions.explanation: King Cyrus made the decree to rebuild the temple in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the ancient priests, Levites, and chief fathers when the foundation of the temple was laid?
questions.explanation: Some wept loudly, others shouted for joy, making the noise indistinguishable.

questions.question: What did the king's decree say about Ezra's requests from the treasurers beyond the river?
options: They must fulfill his requests speedily
They should consult the king first
questions.correctAnswer: They must fulfill his requests speedily
questions.explanation: Artaxerxes ordered that Ezraâ€™s requests be done speedily.

questions.question: Where was the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia stirred up to make the proclamation?
questions.explanation: Cyrus made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom.

questions.question: Who was given the vessels of gold and silver taken from the house of the LORD by Nebuchadnezzar?
questions.explanation: Cyrus gave the vessels to Sheshbazzar to carry back to Jerusalem.

questions.question: What was the occupation of Ezra as described in the book of Ezra?
questions.explanation: Ezra was a priest and a ready scribe in the law of Moses.

questions.question: How did the people respond when the altar was built and offerings began?
options: With fear of the people in the lands around
questions.correctAnswer: With fear of the people in the lands around
questions.explanation: They set the altar upon its bases for fear was upon them because of the people of those countries.

questions.question: Who was the treasurer that helped bring the vessels of the house of the LORD from Babylon to Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Mithredath the treasurer brought the vessels to Sheshbazzar.

questions.question: True or False: The rebuilding of the temple was completed quickly after the foundation was laid.
questions.explanation: The temple building continued for many years and was not finished quickly (Ezra 5:16).

questions.question: True or False: The people of the land, including Tatnai and Shetharboznai, attempted to stop the rebuilding of the temple.
questions.explanation: Officials questioned the Jews and tried to investigate and stop the work (Ezra 5:3-6).

questions.question: True or False: The vessels taken by Nebuchadnezzar were kept in the temple of Babylon until Cyrus took them out.
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar put the vessels in the house of his gods and Cyrus later took them out (Ezra 1:7,14).

questions.question: True or False: Ezra was sent by King Artaxerxes with a letter and a decree to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Ezra was sent with a letter to inquire about Judah and Jerusalem (Ezra 7:11-14).

questions.question: Who were the assistants helping Jeshua and Zerubbabel in the work at the temple, appointed from twenty years old and upward?
questions.explanation: Levites from twenty years old and upward were appointed to set forward the work of the house.

questions.question: What did the people do with the foundation of the temple that showed mixed emotions?
options: They all rejoiced with no sadness
They shouted and wept loudly at the same time
questions.correctAnswer: They shouted and wept loudly at the same time
questions.explanation: Ancient priests and Levites who remembered the first temple wept while others shouted for joy.
